Job Title: Pacific Northwest Manager, Program Partnerships (only candidates living in PNW need apply)
Job Description: Are you passionate about transforming education and building partnerships that empower educators and students? Join our Bill of Rights Institute team as Manager of Regional Programs serving the Pacific Northwest, including Washington, Oregon, Idaho, and Montana. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in establishing and managing relationships with school districts and educators, driving partnership opportunities, and fostering collaborations to advance civic education initiatives. If you excel in dynamic environments and are committed to making a tangible impact in education, this position is perfect for you. Responsibilities · Establish and maintain relationships with school districts and educators in the Pacific Northwest to facilitate collaboration and support the adoption of resources from the Bill of Rights Institute. · Oversee the management of school and district relationships as assigned from initial engagement through program completion, ensuring satisfaction and successful outcomes. · Allocate 30% of your schedule to travel, engaging with stakeholders, attending conferences, and conducting outreach activities. Qualifications · Collaborate with key stakeholders in the Pacific Northwest to identify and cultivate leads for program and fee-for-service opportunities. · Initiate and oversee partnerships in the Pacific Northwest with state social studies councils, historical societies, museums, and other civic education organizations to broaden outreach and impact. Qualifications · Must live in an urban area in the Pacific Northwest. Preference given to those living in the state of Washington and near a major airport. · Bachelor's degree in education or related field (Master's degree preferred). · Experience as a classroom teacher or in the education field. Preference given to those with experience in charter, private, or classical schools. · Proven experience in cultivating and managing relationships with school districts, educators, and educational organizations. · Strong business development skills, with a track record of identifying and pursuing educational partnership opportunities. Preference given to those with experience in developing fee-for-service work and/or a background in fundraising. · Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage diverse stakeholders. · Knowledge of educational trends, curriculum standards, and pedagogical strategies in social studies education preferred. · Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of juggling multiple priorities and deadlines effectively. · A willingness to travel frequently and work flexible hours as needed to fulfill the demands of the role. · Deep commitment to constitutional principles and robust civic education. · If you are enthusiastic about supporting excellent civic education and are eager to play a pivotal role in advancing civic education by supporting educators, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in empowering educators and students with the resources they need to become informed and engaged citizens. Your cover letter and resume should demonstrate your writing skills and accuracy as well as let us know why you want to work at the Bill of Rights Institute. Please apply directly through our website at https://billofrightsinstitute.org/about-bri/join-our-team or through Indeed.Include a cover letter describing why you want to work for the Bill of Rights Institute.
